sentences.en: During heartbreak , love is a doggerel, caustic and mocking, eloquent and glib.
sentences.cn: 相恨的时候, 爱情是一首打油诗, 嘲弄讥讽 、 各逞其能.

sentences.en: Glib, I know: I've often said it myself to wind up environmentalists.
sentences.cn: 有点滑头, 我知道: 为了哄骗环保主义者,我自己也常常这么说.

sentences.en: Griffiths is glib and has a lot of superficial information on a number of subjects.
sentences.cn: 格里菲思能说会道,对许多问题都有点一知半解.

sentences.en: He carried the others off their feet, glib, dexterous, voluble.
sentences.cn: 他叫大家发起狂来,讲得口若悬河, 伶俐乖巧, 滔滔不绝.
他说起话来油腔滑调的.

sentences.en: He has a glib tongue. Few people can argue him down.
sentences.cn: 他有三寸不烂之舌, 几乎没人能把他驳倒.

sentences.en: His glib talk sounds as sweet as a song.
I never knew he had such a glib tongue.
sentences.cn: 我从前并不知道他这样油嘴.

sentences.en: Kunming where to buy a flower and skill in glib petty gain?
sentences.cn: 昆明哪里买花和精油便宜?

sentences.en: Mr. Lewis takes an insufferably glib attitude toward it all.
sentences.cn: 刘易斯先生对这一切不以为意，令人厌恶。

sentences.en: She's always ready with a glib excuse.
The fellow has a very glib tongue.
The spokesman's answer was just too glib.
sentences.cn: 发言人的回答太圆滑了.

sentences.en: Was I too glib about eternal things? ( Theodore Roethke ).
sentences.cn: 难道我对不朽事物太过于油嘴滑舌? ( 西奥多罗特克 )

sentences.en: Your big mouth and glib tongue are spouting all kinds of nonsense.
sentences.cn: 你只靠一张油嘴,胡说八道.

words.tran_cn: 流畅地；流利地；油嘴滑舌地
口齿伶俐的，油嘴滑舌的

trans.tran_cn: <贬>（演讲者或演讲）油腔滑调的，不诚恳的，未经思考的，肤浅的
trans.tran_en: If you describe what someone says as glib, you disapprove of it because it implies that something is simple or easy, or that there are no problems involved, when this is not the case
